intro: Potamogeton alpinus, commonly known as alpine pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to cold, freshwater environments. It has long, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually found in clusters near the water surface. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Potamogeton alpinus is often found in lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams in temperate and alpine regions.
